name: 賀一平
objective: 本課程之設計是用來發展現代各種英語教學法之理論與實務。
schedule:
Week					Topic
1	Orientation: An Overview of Language Teaching Approaches and Methods
2	The Grammar-Translation Method; The Direct Method; The Audio-Lingual Method; Total Physical Response and the Natural Approach
3	Community Language Learning; Suggestopedia; The Silent Way
4	Communicative Language Teaching for the Twenty-First Century
5	Cooperative Language Learning; Tasked-Based Language Teaching; Content-Based Approach
6	Whole Language; Reader Response
7	Teaching by Principles: Cognitive, Socio-affective, Linguistic Principles
8	Second Language Learning/Acquisition Theories
9	Mid-Term Exam
10	Approaches to educational psychology: Behaviorism; Cognitive Psychology; Humanism; Social Interactionism; Constructivist View of Learning
11	Teaching Reading
12	Teaching Writing
13	Teaching Listening
14	Teaching Speaking
15	Teaching Grammar and Vocabulary
16	Focus on the Learner and the Learning Process; Strategies-Based Instruction
17	Syllabus Design
18	Final Exam
materials:
Brown, H. D. (2007). Teaching by principles: An interactive approach to language pedagogy. White Plains, NY: Pearson.
Larsen-Freeman, D. (2000). Techniques and principles in language teaching.  Oxford: Oxford University Press.
Richards, J. C., & Rodgers, T. S. (2001). Approaches and methods in language teaching.  New York: Cambridge University Press.
Brown, H. D. (2007). Principles of language learning and teaching. White Plains, NY: Pearson.
Nunan, D. (1999). Second language teaching and learning.  Boston, MA: Heinle & Heinle.
Celce-Murcia, M. (2001). Teaching English as a second or foreign language.  Boston, MA: Heinle & Heinle.
Hadley, A. O. (2001). Teaching language in context.  Boston, MA: Heinle & Heinle.
Carter, R., & Nunan, D. (2001). The Cambridge guide to teaching English to speakers of other languages.  New York: Cambridge University Press.
Mitchell, R., & Myles, F. (1998). Second language learning theories.  New York: Oxford University Press.
Williams, M., & Burden, R. L. (1997). Psychology for language teachers: A social constructivist approach. New York, NY: Cambridge University Press.
Nunan, D. (2003). Practical English language teaching.  New York, NY: McGraw-Hill/Contemporary.
